programme.title: Les enfants du paradis
Deca raja
programme.desc:
Les enfants du paradis: Directed by Marcel Carné. With Arletty, Jean-Louis Barrault, Pierre Brasseur, Pierre Renoir. The theatrical life of a beautiful courtesan and the four men who love her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0037674/","name":"Les enfants du paradis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjVjYTAzYjctZTZkNi00NmNhLWJkY2UtNjEyOWQ5NTI0MmEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDE5MTU2MDE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001916/","name":"Arletty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0056761/","name":"Jean-Louis Barrault"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0105482/","name":"Pierre Brasseur"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0138893/","name":"Marcel Carné"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047571/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0699535/","name":"Jacques Prévert"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Children of Paradise: The Criterion Collection","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2468132889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTM0OWRiNTUtNGQ0NC00YzFiLWI0ZDMtOTMwMTZlYzJhYjdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTM0OWRiNTUtNGQ0NC00YzFiLWI0ZDMtOTMwMTZlYzJhYjdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three Reasons Criterion Trailer for Children of Paradise"},"datePublished":"1946-03-15","description":"The theatrical life of a beautiful courtesan and the four men who love her.","keywords":"thief,murder,theater,turkish bath,womanizer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0037674/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Spondonman"},"dateCreated":"2007-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Paradise Found","reviewBody":"It's one of the best films ever made and one of my favourite films, although the first time I attempted to see it at 14 years old in 1973 I didn't understand it at all. I tried again four years older and it won me over. Personal tastes vary not only between people but within people over time. Nowadays I can't understand why some people can't understand it and get nothing from this timeless world classic - at the very least they could look upon it as the closest the French cinema ever got to Dickens.

Meandering tale set in 1840's France has whimsically smiling Garance played by Arletty in love with mime artist Baptiste played perfectly by Jean-Louis Barrault but with three other men in love with her too. These are the Dramatic Actor Lemaitre played by Pierre Brasseur (Lucien from Le Quai Des Brumes), the cynically corrupt Lacenaire by Marcel Herrond (Renaud from Les Visiteurs Du Soir) and stiffly possessive Montray by Louis Salou. With Maria Casares as the faithful Nathalie the trouper in love with Baptiste and you have the main cast for your delectation. Just as the characters in the plays at the Funambules depended upon the pleasure of the audience up in "the Gods" so do the actors on the screen – although now thanks to TV and DVD us people up in the Gods are a lot more distant! The main thread is how and why all the tangled love affairs unravel. The film is littered with eccentric characters and heavy poetic observations, backed up with a logical plot, incredible sets and unforgettable acting – all made under the Nazi occupation. Adversity often heightens the senses, but Carne and Prevert excelled themselves with this production. Favourite bits: Baptiste proving Garrance's innocence of stealing a watch in mime to the assembled crowd; the touchy scenes inside the aptly-named Robin Redbreast pub; Garance and Lemaitre in the deeply shaded box at the Funambules watching Baptiste perform; his calling her beautiful and her response of "No, just alive, that's all"; Lemaitre revising the play in which he was acting on the stage; his opinion of mulled wine – "Like God slipping down your throat in red velvet breeches"; Lacenaire's lacerated opinion of everything – especially of Montray; the bookend bustling street scenes at the start and finish; the astounding ending; and on and on – so much richness to see and hear in three hours!

It's a world portrayed in great detail and lovingly, done in the best French tradition: dreamy, full of poetry, a frisson of sex and a little violence. As with me, it may need a little patience to cultivate this particular flower, but if you allow it into your heart it will never leave you again. Definitely High Art!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18817,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"duration":"PT3H9M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Lan Yu
Lan Ju
programme.desc:
Lan Yu: Directed by Stanley Kwan. With Ye Liu, Jun Hu, Bin Li, Huatong Li. A young, gay student has a relationship with an older, successful businessman. The handsome playboy-businessman must choose between his comfortable, yet closeted straight life, or an honest, yet subversive life with the student." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0292066/","name":"Lan Yu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA1MzU1MTg3OTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDQ3MjQwNDE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1091782/","name":"Ye Liu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0432425/","name":"Jun Hu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1222856/","name":"Bin Li"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0477102/","name":"Stanley Kwan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0058991/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078891/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0628873/","name":"Jimmy Ngai"}],"datePublished":"2001-11-22","description":"A young, gay student has a relationship with an older, successful businessman. The handsome playboy-businessman must choose between his comfortable, yet closeted straight life, or an honest, yet subversive life with the student.","keywords":"student,shower,bar,gay,reference to la vie en rose the song","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0292066/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alanjj"},"dateCreated":"2004-01-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's as hot as a gay mainstream movie can be, and it's from China!","reviewBody":"I expected something tepid and tormented, like "East Palace West Palace" and instead found a wonderful drama about the China of the 80s and 90s.

A successful businessman sees, at a fancy party, a young man brought to the party by another attendee. He and a co-worker decide to pounce: they take him (Lan Yu) out and treat him royally. The young man winds up staying with the businessman, who gives him money, but is ambivalent about whether he wants to see Lan Yu again. He feels that he can have relationships and remain unattached.

Lan Yu shows up periodically over the course of years, and the businessman gives him larger and larger gifts, including a fancy house in the suburbs. But the businessman meets a woman who translates for him in a deal he's making with Russians. He decides to marry the woman. Lan Yu will not put up with it and refuses to see the businessman.

The businessman's shady deals get him into trouble, and he loses almost everything. Then Lan Yu comes back into the picture and . . . (I'll leave it there).

Besides being a wonderful melodrama, this is also a hot gay film. Full frontal and dorsal nudity, some sex. The men are hairless and sexy, but real. Lots of kissing. 

And all the time you're wondering: did they actually film this in China? Do they allow this in China? How did they get away with this....It must have been filmed in Hong Kong. Well, according to the Sundance website, this was filmed in China, and based on a short story that appeared only on the Internet.

It's by far my favorite Chinese movie, and if you're interested in gay life in the new China, this is the one to see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2208,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

Favourite bits: Baptiste proving Garrance's innocence of stealing a watch in mime to the assembled crowd; the touchy scenes inside the aptly-named Robin Redbreast pub; Garance and Lemaitre in the deeply shaded box at the Funambules watching Baptiste perform; his calling her beautiful and her response of "No, just alive, that's all"; Lemaitre revising the play in which he was acting on the stage; his opinion of mulled wine – "Like God slipping down your throat in red velvet breeches"; Lacenaire's lacerated opinion of everything – especially of Montray; the bookend bustling street scenes at the start and finish; the astounding ending; and on and on – so much richness to see and hear in three hours!

It's a world portrayed in great detail and lovingly, done in the best French tradition: dreamy, full of poetry, a frisson of sex and a little violence. As with me, it may need a little patience to cultivate this particular flower, but if you allow it into your heart it will never leave you again. Definitely High Art!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18817,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"duration":"PT3H9M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0037674, Title: Les enfants du paradis, --- Description: Les enfants du paradis: Directed by Marcel Carné. With Arletty, Jean-Louis Barrault, Pierre Brasseur, Pierre Renoir. The theatrical life of a beautiful courtesan and the four men who love her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0037674/","name":"Les enfants du paradis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjVjYTAzYjctZTZkNi00NmNhLWJkY2UtNjEyOWQ5NTI0MmEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDE5MTU2MDE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001916/","name":"Arletty","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0056761/","name":"Jean-Louis Barrault","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0105482/","name":"Pierre Brasseur"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0138893/","name":"Marcel Carné"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047571/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0699535/","name":"Jacques Prévert"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Children of Paradise: The Criterion Collection","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2468132889","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTM0OWRiNTUtNGQ0NC00YzFiLWI0ZDMtOTMwMTZlYzJhYjdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTM0OWRiNTUtNGQ0NC00YzFiLWI0ZDMtOTMwMTZlYzJhYjdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three Reasons Criterion Trailer for Children of Paradise","datePublished":"1946-03-15","description":"The theatrical life of a beautiful courtesan and the four men who love her.","keywords":"thief,murder,theater,turkish bath,womanizer","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0037674/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Spondonman","dateCreated":"2007-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Paradise Found","reviewBody":"It's one of the best films ever made and one of my favourite films, although the first time I attempted to see it at 14 years old in 1973 I didn't understand it at all. I tried again four years older and it won me over. Personal tastes vary not only between people but within people over time. Nowadays I can't understand why some people can't understand it and get nothing from this timeless world classic - at the very least they could look upon it as the closest the French cinema ever got to Dickens.

Meandering tale set in 1840's France has whimsically smiling Garance played by Arletty in love with mime artist Baptiste played perfectly by Jean-Louis Barrault but with three other men in love with her too. These are the Dramatic Actor Lemaitre played by Pierre Brasseur (Lucien from Le Quai Des Brumes), the cynically corrupt Lacenaire by Marcel Herrond (Renaud from Les Visiteurs Du Soir) and stiffly possessive Montray by Louis Salou. With Maria Casares as the faithful Nathalie the trouper in love with Baptiste and you have the main cast for your delectation. Just as the characters in the plays at the Funambules depended upon the pleasure of the audience up in "the Gods" so do the actors on the screen – although now thanks to TV and DVD us people up in the Gods are a lot more distant! The main thread is how and why all the tangled love affairs unravel. The film is littered with eccentric characters and heavy poetic observations, backed up with a logical plot, incredible sets and unforgettable acting – all made under the Nazi occupation. Adversity often heightens the senses, but Carne and Prevert excelled themselves with this production. Favourite bits: Baptiste proving Garrance's innocence of stealing a watch in mime to the assembled crowd; the touchy scenes inside the aptly-named Robin Redbreast pub; Garance and Lemaitre in the deeply shaded box at the Funambules watching Baptiste perform; his calling her beautiful and her response of "No, just alive, that's all"; Lemaitre revising the play in which he was acting on the stage; his opinion of mulled wine – "Like God slipping down your throat in red velvet breeches"; Lacenaire's lacerated opinion of everything – especially of Montray; the bookend bustling street scenes at the start and finish; the astounding ending; and on and on – so much richness to see and hear in three hours!

It's a world portrayed in great detail and lovingly, done in the best French tradition: dreamy, full of poetry, a frisson of sex and a little violence. As with me, it may need a little patience to cultivate this particular flower, but if you allow it into your heart it will never leave you again. Definitely High Art!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":18817,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4,"duration":"PT3H9M"</script><metacontent="

a decrepit South American village, four men are hired to transport an urgent nitroglycerine shipment without the equipment that would make it safe.","keywords":"risk,nitroglycerin,crude oil,oil,oil company","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0046268/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"barleeku"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the greatest movies ever made","reviewBody":"This movie is astonishing, a gritty story filmed in an ultra-real style that relies simply on the beauty of lighting and film to achieve its stunning effects. It seems from another world, which in a way, it is. The acting is superb: Montand's Mario is full of jerky movements and intense impulses but always maintains his Gallic savoir-faire, while Charles Vanel as Jo brings, at first at least, a type of macho to the screen that modern movie-makers simply do not comprehend. The rest of the cast, especially the camp chief, Luigi, and Peter van Eyck as Bimba are incredible, as is Vera Clouzot who is incomprehensibly but believably upbeat and innocent - and totally gorgeous - in the midst of the hellhole of a town they're all stuck in. Clouzot's directing is flawless - I don't think anyone has ever squeezed more tension with just a few essential scene elements. The trucks wheeze and grunt as well as they ever have in the movies - the only comparison is Spielberg's early gem, "The Duel", but Clouzot's automotive cinematics outdo even Spielberg. The stripped down existentialism of the characters, the starkness of their shared dilemma, the grim and grimy scenery, and the cinematography itself are all of a piece. The latter is what elevates this movie to the very top rank, including some of the most dramatic and effective black and white shooting I've ever seen. Yet it never becomes mannered or gratuitous - it is orchestrated with the rise - and rise! - of tension in the film. The final scene takes on a surreal as opposed to ultra-realistic quality that has its own logic. One last word about the acting - we don't see anything like it anymore. The self-conscious mannerism of method acting (which has had its own triumphs) and the toxic awareness of everyone from the actors to the audience, the camera, directors, etc. that each actor is a celebrity and potential artiste, has ruined that conviction that actors were once larger than life people before they went on-screen, that they came to acting as an outcome of living rough, unadorned, and yet imaginative lives as opposed to shooting for fame and fortune and celebrity within an artificial corporate star-making incubator.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":56906,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"duration":"PT2H11M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kimyô na sâkasu
Čudan cirkus
programme.desc:
Kimyô na sâkasu: Directed by Sion Sono. With Masumi Miyazaki, Issei Ishida, Rie Kuwana, Seiko Iwaidô. The erotic novelist Taeko is writing a morbid story of a family destroyed by incest, murder and abuse. Her assistant, Yuji, sets on a mission to uncover the reality of this story, but the reality might be too much to bear." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0492784/","name":"Kimyô na sâkasu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Q2MDIyYjctOTdkYi00YmM4LWFhYzItYmM5MjQyNzZjMGQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1185736/","name":"Masumi Miyazaki"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0410917/","name":"Issei Ishida"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2130525/","name":"Rie Kuwana"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0814469/","name":"Sion Sono"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003357/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0814469/","name":"Sion Sono"}],"datePublished":"2005-12-24","description":"The erotic novelist Taeko is writing a morbid story of a family destroyed by incest, murder and abuse. Her assistant, Yuji, sets on a mission to uncover the reality of this story, but the reality might be too much to bear.","keywords":"cello,mother and daughter played by same actress,father daughter incest,forced to watch sex,seeing parents have sex","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0492784/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"songbee"},"dateCreated":"2008-09-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"A disturbing masterpiece that draws you in.","reviewBody":"This is the first of its kind (I'm sure there are more like this movie out there) that I've seen, so I don't consider my vote fair. 

During the movie, I had mixed feelings of: this is disgusting, this is a masterpiece, this is amazing, this is horrendous. 

Right after watching the movie, I definitely thought, "What did I just spend my 2 hours watching?"

However, I believe this is an amazing film. Even though it's disturbing, the story is great, the film is excellently shot - the film IS motivated to tell that story, however weird it may be.

I recommend this movie, especially if you're looking for something new, something to think about; if you're studying film or if you're just bored. :)

My last comment is: I thoroughly enjoyed this movie, and I recommend it to others.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5315,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Holiday Inn
Holiday Inn
programme.desc:
Holiday Inn: Directed by Mark Sandrich, Robert Allen. With Bing Crosby, Fred Astaire, Marjorie Reynolds, Virginia Dale. At an inn which is open only on holidays, a crooner and a hoofer vie for the affections of a beautiful up-and-coming performer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0034862/","name":"Holiday Inn","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyODU0OTUwMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTE4NTQzMjE@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Passed","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Music"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001078/","name":"Bing Crosby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000001/","name":"Fred Astaire"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0721851/","name":"Marjorie Reynolds"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0762263/","name":"Mark Sandrich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0020980/","name":"Robert Allen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0083125/","name":"Claude Binyon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0723418/","name":"Elmer Rice"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000927/","name":"Irving Berlin"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1764998937","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY5OWVjYWQtZmFmYi00ODg1LWI4MDAtZjUxMjVjYzBhNjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTY5OWVjYWQtZmFmYi00ODg1LWI4MDAtZjUxMjVjYzBhNjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"1942-09-04","description":"At an inn which is open only on holidays, a crooner and a hoofer vie for the affections of a beautiful up-and-coming performer.","keywords":"blackface,show business,cigarette smoking,1930s,1940s","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0034862/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mcade"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Holiday Inn - Truly Classic","reviewBody":"I always feel that a true classic is either a film or a song that within a few feet of film or a few bars of a tune, you know exactly what the song or film is and in most cases the cast or artist who was involved with it.

This film, in my opinion, is no exception. The casting of this film (Bing Crosby as Jim Hardy and Fred Astaire as Ted Hanover) is pure genius. Both stars were really at their professional peaks at the time and they show it in this movie musical.

Both Marjorie Reynolds as Linda Mason and Virginia Dale as Lila Dixon were not as well known, but I feel they both more than proved themselves in holding their own against the talents of Astaire & Crosby.

The supporting cast were fine too. Louise Beavers as well as Walter Abel gave some comedic relief in their roles as Mamie & as Danny Reid.

The firecracker dance sequence with Astaire is well worth the price of admission alone! I also enjoyed the dancing sequence between Astaire & Dale during the "Your Easy to Dance With" number and between Astaire & Reynolds during the "Be Careful Its My Heart" number.

Truly a wonderful film despite the controversy surrounding the "Abraham" black face routine.

When I first saw this film, I never thought about it as being filmed to offend anyone, I just considered it was the only way to explain in the plot why Ted & Danny don't recognize Linda since Jim has been hiding her from them. I have never changed my feelings on this and still feel the same way some 35 years later after my original viewing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13825,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

Truly Classic","reviewBody":"I always feel that a true classic is either a film or a song that within a few feet of film or a few bars of a tune, you know exactly what the song or film is and in most cases the cast or artist who was involved with it.

This film, in my opinion, is no exception. The casting of this film (Bing Crosby as Jim Hardy and Fred Astaire as Ted Hanover) is pure genius. Both stars were really at their professional peaks at the time and they show it in this movie musical.

Both Marjorie Reynolds as Linda Mason and Virginia Dale as Lila Dixon were not as well known, but I feel they both more than proved themselves in holding their own against the talents of Astaire & Crosby.

The supporting cast were fine too. Louise Beavers as well as Walter Abel gave some comedic relief in their roles as Mamie & as Danny Reid.

The firecracker dance sequence with Astaire is well worth the price of admission alone! I also enjoyed the dancing sequence between Astaire & Dale during the "Your Easy to Dance With" number and between Astaire & Reynolds during the "Be Careful Its My Heart" number.

Truly a wonderful film despite the controversy surrounding the "Abraham" black face routine.

When I first saw this film, I never thought about it as being filmed to offend anyone, I just considered it was the only way to explain in the plot why Ted & Danny don't recognize Linda since Jim has been hiding her from them. programme.title: Alexander the Great
Aleksandar Veliki
programme.desc:
Alexander the Great: Directed by Robert Rossen. With Richard Burton, Fredric March, Claire Bloom, Barry Jones. The life and military conquests of Alexander III of Macedon (July 20/21, 356 - June 10/11, 323 B.C.), commonly known as Alexander the Great." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0048937/","name":"Alexander the Great","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk2MTAzZDItN2Q5Ni00Y2FmLWE4NDEtZDBiYjkzMjFlOWI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000009/","name":"Richard Burton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545298/","name":"Fredric March"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001954/","name":"Claire Bloom"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744035/","name":"Robert Rossen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064766/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043911/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0744035/","name":"Robert Rossen"}],"datePublished":"1956-03-23","description":"The life and military conquests of Alexander III of Macedon (July 20/21, 356 - June 10/11, 323 B.C.), commonly known as Alexander the Great.","keywords":"battlefield,greece,ancient greece,alexander the great character,character name as title","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0048937/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dmatthews03"},"dateCreated":"2001-11-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Draggy, would be epic.","reviewBody":"This is one of those international productions popular in the 1950's. Made in Spain with British, American and French actors.

Robert Rossen is a good director with many fine movies to his credit but really doesn't seem to have the flair for historical epics. There is too much talk and the battle scenes tend to be rather confusing and poorly choreographed.

Richard Burton does his best, his magnificent voice can make something of the most mundane dialogue and he certainly looks virile despite a rather swish looking blonde wig.

A good supporting cast is largely wasted."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3446,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"duration":"PT2H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Spartacus
Spartak
programme.desc:
Spartacus: Directed by Stanley Kubrick. With Kirk Douglas, Laurence Olivier, Jean Simmons, Charles Laughton. The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0054331/","name":"Spartacus","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc4MTUxN2UtMmU1NC00MjQyLTk3YTYtZTQ0YzEzZDc0Njc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Biography","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000018/","name":"Kirk Douglas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000059/","name":"Laurence Olivier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001739/","name":"Jean Simmons"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000040/","name":"Stanley Kubrick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068126/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0874308/","name":"Dalton Trumbo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268779/","name":"Howard Fast"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001811/","name":"Peter Ustinov"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1415363353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDljYjRlOWEtNzgxYS00M2JiLTkxNmEtYzNkOTI0Y2RkMGEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDljYjRlOWEtNzgxYS00M2JiLTkxNmEtYzNkOTI0Y2RkMGEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"1960-11-17","description":"The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.","keywords":"slave rebellion,roman republic,gladiator,freedom,slave revolt","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0054331/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Arriflex1"},"dateCreated":"2004-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Controlling Stanley: The Spartacus Experience","reviewBody":"As most are undoubtedly aware this is the film that the director virtually expunged from his repertoire. But why did Stanley Kubrick really disown SPARTACUS (1960)? The answer can be summed up in two words: absolute control. Kubrick wanted total administrative as well as artistic authority over the making of the film about a revolt of gladiators and slaves in ancient Rome.

But you will notice that Bryna Productions not only financed SPARTACUS but also an earlier film directed by Kubrick, PATHS OF GLORY (1958). Bryna was Kirk Douglas' film company and, as most filmgoers know, he was the star of both films. Besides having all the money to make the films, Douglas had artistic vision as well. Only three weeks into what would prove to be an incredibly complex and arduous production, Douglas fired venerable director Anthony Mann (RAW DEAL, RAILROADED,THE FURIES, THE NAKED SPUR, THE MAN FROM LARAMIE, MAN OF THE WEST, etc.) from SPARTACUS. With only two days notice, Kubrick was hired to replace him.

Shooting PATHS OF GLORY, Douglas had confined his criticisms and objections to Kubrick's failed rewriting of the script (they went with the original screenplay). Douglas' complaints and artistic influence were far greater on SPARTACUS, much to Kubrick's chagrin. Though the director craved autonomy over every aspect of the film, Douglas would not budge. A tense compromise was reached but ultimately Douglas had the last word. Kubrick saw himself as just a hired gun. And he would never allow himself to be placed in this position again.

Later, both men would complain about the film's outcome and each other. They never made another movie together. 

But SPARTACUS is no uneven patchwork of divergent ideas. The film is cohesive and arresting. At the restored version of three hours and eighteen minutes, there is practically no dead footage in the film. Dalton Trumbo's screenplay is surprisingly economical, with sharply drawn characters placed against the sweeping historical majesty and violent sociological tumult of ancient Rome. Quite plainly, the gloriously inventive music by Alex North is among the greatest scores ever written for a motion picture. And despite Kubrick's bad experience, he managed to guide the actors towards creating outstanding work (a best supporting actor Oscar for Peter Ustinov). He even transformed the very real enmity between Laughton and Olivier into an on-screen asset. His other contributions were considerable also (the large scale and power of the battle sequence, for example). In the end, for the film at least, the clash of giant egos proved fortuitous. Recommendations: for greater insight and detail on this and Kubrick's other films I urge you to seek out Jan Harlan's excellent documentary, STANLEY KUBRICK: A LIFE IN PICTURES, and Vincent LoBrutto's exhaustive, highly informative biography, STANLEY KUBRICK. For the producer's views on SPARTACUS and its director, take a gander at Kirk Douglas' very candid autobiography, THE RAGMAN'S SON.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":128525,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"duration":"PT3H17M"}</script><metacontent="

Diamond"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Monkey Business","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3713991193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNkMjZhZjYtMmUxZC00MmFiLWJkMTItNjgyYWI3YTA2YTY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNkMjZhZjYtMmUxZC00MmFiLWJkMTItNjgyYWI3YTA2YTY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this classic comedy starring Cary Grant and Ginger Rogers"},"datePublished":"1952-09-05","description":"A chemist finds his personal and professional life turned upside down when one of his chimpanzees finds the fountain of youth.","keywords":"chimpanzee,age regression,husband wife relationship,invention,fountain of youth","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0044916/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Steve-318"},"dateCreated":"2003-07-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Give this one ape for effort","reviewBody":"Thoroughly enjoyable comedy with Cary Grant as the absent-minded professor who's messing around looking for the fountain of youth. Ginger Rogers gets to dance a little without Fred Astaire plus demonstrate a wonderful comic style as she mixes it up with Marilyn Monroe. It's 1952 but you wouldn't know it (except for Marilyn's presence). Howard Hawks takes you back to the good old days when Hollywood demonstrated total mastery of time and space with the screwball comedy.

Along with monkeyshines and child actors, you really get a lot in this film: Grant and Rogers play off each other very nicely and the driving scene with Monroe and Grant is a classic. Adding to the hijinx is Charles Coburn, who always dominates the screen with his easy charm. I bet he loved chasing after Monroe with a spray bottle. 

The movie holds up well over 50 years later which makes one wonder why Hollywood hasn't, cringe, chosen to ape the storyline for Jim Carrey or maybe Tom Hanks, who might be looking for a comic turn these days.

But then they remade Freaky Friday this summer, didn't they?","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13422,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

Why? Because villain uses a ray to disable the craft, then captures craft and crew intact. There must be half a dozen Bond films with this plot. programme.title: Spartacus
Spartak
programme.desc:
Spartacus: Directed by Stanley Kubrick. With Kirk Douglas, Laurence Olivier, Jean Simmons, Charles Laughton. The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0054331/","name":"Spartacus","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjc4MTUxN2UtMmU1NC00MjQyLTk3YTYtZTQ0YzEzZDc0Njc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjU0OTQ0OTY@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Biography","Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000018/","name":"Kirk Douglas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000059/","name":"Laurence Olivier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001739/","name":"Jean Simmons"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000040/","name":"Stanley Kubrick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068126/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0874308/","name":"Dalton Trumbo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268779/","name":"Howard Fast"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001811/","name":"Peter Ustinov"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1415363353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDljYjRlOWEtNzgxYS00M2JiLTkxNmEtYzNkOTI0Y2RkMGEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDljYjRlOWEtNzgxYS00M2JiLTkxNmEtYzNkOTI0Y2RkMGEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"1960-11-17","description":"The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.","keywords":"slave rebellion,roman republic,gladiator,freedom,slave revolt","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0054331/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Arriflex1"},"dateCreated":"2004-07-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Controlling Stanley: The Spartacus Experience","reviewBody":"As most are undoubtedly aware this is the film that the director virtually expunged from his repertoire. But why did Stanley Kubrick really disown SPARTACUS (1960)? The answer can be summed up in two words: absolute control. Kubrick wanted total administrative as well as artistic authority over the making of the film about a revolt of gladiators and slaves in ancient Rome.

But you will notice that Bryna Productions not only financed SPARTACUS but also an earlier film directed by Kubrick, PATHS OF GLORY (1958). Bryna was Kirk Douglas' film company and, as most filmgoers know, he was the star of both films. Besides having all the money to make the films, Douglas had artistic vision as well. Only three weeks into what would prove to be an incredibly complex and arduous production, Douglas fired venerable director Anthony Mann (RAW DEAL, RAILROADED,THE FURIES, THE NAKED SPUR, THE MAN FROM LARAMIE, MAN OF THE WEST, etc.) from SPARTACUS. With only two days notice, Kubrick was hired to replace him.

Shooting PATHS OF GLORY, Douglas had confined his criticisms and objections to Kubrick's failed rewriting of the script (they went with the original screenplay). Douglas' complaints and artistic influence were far greater on SPARTACUS, much to Kubrick's chagrin. Though the director craved autonomy over every aspect of the film, Douglas would not budge. A tense compromise was reached but ultimately Douglas had the last word. Kubrick saw himself as just a hired gun. And he would never allow himself to be placed in this position again.

Later, both men would complain about the film's outcome and each other. They never made another movie together. 

But SPARTACUS is no uneven patchwork of divergent ideas. The film is cohesive and arresting. At the restored version of three hours and eighteen minutes, there is practically no dead footage in the film. Dalton Trumbo's screenplay is surprisingly economical, with sharply drawn characters placed against the sweeping historical majesty and violent sociological tumult of ancient Rome. Quite plainly, the gloriously inventive music by Alex North is among the greatest scores ever written for a motion picture. And despite Kubrick's bad experience, he managed to guide the actors towards creating outstanding work (a best supporting actor Oscar for Peter Ustinov). He even transformed the very real enmity between Laughton and Olivier into an on-screen asset. His other contributions were considerable also (the large scale and power of the battle sequence, for example). In the end, for the film at least, the clash of giant egos proved fortuitous. Recommendations: for greater insight and detail on this and Kubrick's other films I urge you to seek out Jan Harlan's excellent documentary, STANLEY KUBRICK: A LIFE IN PICTURES, and Vincent LoBrutto's exhaustive, highly informative biography, STANLEY KUBRICK. For the producer's views on SPARTACUS and its director, take a gander at Kirk Douglas' very candid autobiography, THE RAGMAN'S SON.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":128525,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"duration":"PT3H17M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Monkey Business: Directed by Howard Hawks. With Cary Grant, Ginger Rogers, Charles Coburn, Marilyn Monroe. A chemist finds his personal and professional life turned upside down when one of his chimpanzees finds the fountain of youth." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0044916/","name":"Monkey Business","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWMwNDFiZGItYmMwNy00NThhLWJkODktNDQxYWI3NjMyNGFkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwMzI2NzU@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Comedy","Sci-Fi"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000026/","name":"Cary Grant"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001677/","name":"Ginger Rogers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000054/","name":"Marilyn Monroe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001328/","name":"Howard Hawks"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0372942/","name":"Ben Hecht"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0496468/","name":"Charles Lederer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0224634/","name":"I.A.L. Diamond"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Monkey Business","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3713991193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNkMjZhZjYtMmUxZC00MmFiLWJkMTItNjgyYWI3YTA2YTY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODNkMjZhZjYtMmUxZC00MmFiLWJkMTItNjgyYWI3YTA2YTY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this classic comedy starring Cary Grant and Ginger Rogers"},"datePublished":"1952-09-05","description":"A chemist finds his personal and professional life turned upside down when one of his chimpanzees finds the fountain of youth.","keywords":"chimpanzee,age regression,husband wife relationship,invention,fountain of youth","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0044916/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Steve-318"},"dateCreated":"2003-07-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Give this one ape for effort","reviewBody":"Thoroughly enjoyable comedy with Cary Grant as the absent-minded professor who's messing around looking for the fountain of youth. Ginger Rogers gets to dance a little without Fred Astaire plus demonstrate a wonderful comic style as she mixes it up with Marilyn Monroe. It's 1952 but you wouldn't know it (except for Marilyn's presence). Howard Hawks takes you back to the good old days when Hollywood demonstrated total mastery of time and space with the screwball comedy.

Along with monkeyshines and child actors, you really get a lot in this film: Grant and Rogers play off each other very nicely and the driving scene with Monroe and Grant is a classic. Adding to the hijinx is Charles Coburn, who always dominates the screen with his easy charm. I bet he loved chasing after Monroe with a spray bottle. 

The movie holds up well over 50 years later which makes one wonder why Hollywood hasn't, cringe, chosen to ape the storyline for Jim Carrey or maybe Tom Hanks, who might be looking for a comic turn these days.

But then they remade Freaky Friday this summer, didn't they?","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13422,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

Woods"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0210476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0930178/","name":"Brock Williams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0926525/","name":"Jack Whittingham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0934497/","name":"Arthur Wimperis"}],"datePublished":"1939-08-28","description":"A quirky British Secret Service Agent named Major Hammond tries to discover who is using a secret weapon to steal experimental planes.","keywords":"spy,ship,british secret service,war preparedness,propaganda","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0031831/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"clemd"},"dateCreated":"2001-11-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Some very "James Bond" elements, 25 years earlier","reviewBody":"Experimental craft are disappearing. programme.title: The 300 Spartans
300 Spartanaca
programme.desc: The 300 Spartans: Directed by Rudolph Maté. With Richard Egan, Ralph Richardson, Diane Baker, Barry Coe. A small Army of Greeks spearheaded by three hundred Spartans do battle with the whole invading Persian Army." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0055719/","name":"The 300 Spartans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg0MmM4N2YtODExZi00ZDZmLWJiMjAtYTYzOGEwNWUxNGIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"Approved","genre":["Adventure","Drama","History"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0250724/","name":"Richard Egan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0724732/","name":"Ralph Richardson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000832/","name":"Diane Baker"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005789/","name":"Rudolph Maté"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0820532/","name":"George St. George"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0508792/","name":"Ugo Liberatore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0215589/","name":"Remigio Del Grosso"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The 300 Spartans","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3572237337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThiYmE5NDQtNGM5Yi00YjZlLTlhY2MtMjhlYWY1MTM1OWU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThiYmE5NDQtNGM5Yi00YjZlLTlhY2MtMjhlYWY1MTM1OWU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this epic period drama"},"description":"A small Army of Greeks spearheaded by three hundred Spartans do battle with the whole invading Persian Army.","keywords":"battle of thermopylae,army,persian,greek,spartan","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0055719/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MChittum-California"},"dateCreated":"2002-10-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not bad for 40 years ago.","reviewBody":"I was a teenager when I first saw this film. I was raised on the ancient spectacle films of the 50's and 60's and feel this one holds up quite well. No, it's not perfection with respect to history. The Spartans were hardly democratic or benevolent. But, they were fiercely proud, great warriors and very independent. The film does a fine job choreographing the 2-3 day battle, given the budget and FX limitations of the early 60's. Very similar to "Helen of Troy" in these respects. Richard Egan was excellent as Leonidas but the script was very limiting for him and the rest of the cast. I will look forward to seeing the film that results from Steven Pressfield's "Gates of Fire". Hopefully 40+ years of technology will create a true epic, as befitting an action (unknown to most school kids today) that helped preserve and push Western Civilization."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6709,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

A pair of NYC cops in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a drug smuggling job with a French connection." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0067116/","name":"The French Hackman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001702/","name":"Roy Scheider"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0721073/","name":"Fernando Rey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001243/","name":"William Friedkin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0677209/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0045508/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0862781/","name":"Ernest Tidyman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0601811/","name":"Robin Moore"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The French Connection","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2196898073","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTM3YmY5NjUtMjI5MS00MjM1LTk4ZjktMjBlMDdlN2UxYTJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTM3YmY5NjUtMjI5MS00MjM1LTk4ZjktMjBlMDdlN2UxYTJlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for The French Connection"},"datePublished":"1971-10-09","description":"A pair of NYC cops in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a drug smuggling job with a French connection.","keywords":"based on true story,triggerman,heroin,smuggling,new york city","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0067116/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bkoganbing"},"dateCreated":"2009-06-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"One Kinky Cop","reviewBody":"The French Connection and Bullitt have had so many imitators over the past 40 years it's almost impossible to remember that the clichés about police films had their start with these two. Still they did set a standard and should be remembered for that.

My basic problem with The French Connection is the lack of any character development other than Gene Hackman's role. Even his opposite number Fernando Rey is presented as a cool counterpoint to Hackman's Popeye Doyle, narcotics detective who lucked into one of the biggest heroin busts of all time.

Popeye is one of the most unlikely heroes ever portrayed in film. He's a racist bigot, a chauvinistic pig, he's even got a couple of kinks in his sexual persona. I don't think it's an accident that around the time Gene Hackman got his Best Actor Oscar, All In The Family debuted on television with its more lovable version of Popeye. Archie Bunker and Popeye Doyle would have hit it off great. I could see the two of them at Kelsey's Bar in Queens.

Some surveillance at a candy store pays off big time for Hackman and his partner Roy Scheider, but they don't even know how big. Over in Marseilles, Fernando Rey is planning to bring in one big shipment of pure heroin for mobster Tony LoBianco to sell. It's just a question of waiting and watching.

Hackman's not even good at that as Rey gives him the slip on a subway surveillance. Later on in a scene that rivals the car chase in Bullitt, Hackman commandeers a car and chases down one of the gang who holds a subway hostage, I think it's the Sea Beach train a stop or two from Coney Island if memory serves.

The French Connection is based on a book written Green Berets author Robin Moore as told to him by Eddie Egan and Sonny Grosso, the cops who did the actual bust. Both appear in the film in supporting roles. If Popeye is supposed to be Egan, all I can say is that this man told his story in the Cromwell tradition, warts and all.

Big warts at that.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":114106,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

for The French Connection","datePublished":"1971-10-09","description":"A pair of NYC cops in the Narcotics Bureau stumble onto a drug smuggling job with a French connection.","keywords":"based on true story,triggerman,heroin,smuggling,new york city","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0067116/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"bkoganbing","dateCreated":"2009-06-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"One Kinky Cop","reviewBody":"The French Connection and Bullitt have had so many imitators over the past 40 years it's almost impossible to remember that the clichés about police films had their start with these two. Still they did set a standard and should be remembered for that.

My basic problem with The French Connection is the lack of any character development other than Gene Hackman's role. Even his opposite number Fernando Rey is presented as a cool counterpoint to Hackman's Popeye Doyle, narcotics detective who lucked into one of the biggest heroin busts of all time.

Popeye is one of the most unlikely heroes ever portrayed in film. He's a racist bigot, a chauvinistic pig, he's even got a couple of kinks in his sexual persona. I don't think it's an accident that around the time Gene Hackman got his Best Actor Oscar, All In The Family debuted on television with its more lovable version of Popeye. Archie Bunker and Popeye Doyle would have hit it off great. I could see the two of them at Kelsey's Bar in Queens.

Some surveillance at a candy store pays off big time for Hackman and his partner Roy Scheider, but they don't even know how big. Over in Marseilles, Fernando Rey is planning to bring in one big shipment of pure heroin for mobster Tony LoBianco to sell. It's just a question of waiting and watching.

Hackman's not even good at that as Rey gives him the slip on a subway surveillance. Later on in a scene that rivals the car chase in Bullitt, Hackman commandeers a car and chases down one of the gang who holds a subway hostage, I think it's the Sea Beach train a stop or two from Coney Island if memory serves.

The French Connection is based on a book written Green Berets author Robin Moore as told to him by Eddie Egan and Sonny Grosso, the cops who did the actual bust. Both appear in the film in supporting roles. If Popeye is supposed to be Egan, all I can say is that this man told his story in the Cromwell tradition, warts and all.

Big warts at that.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":114106,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"duration":"PT1H44M"</script><metacontent="

An uptight English writer travelling to Crete, on a matter of business, finds his life changed forever when he meets the gregarious Alexis Zorba." data-id="main"/><script Greek","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1104413721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWMwMjVkYTQtYmVmYi00YjBjLTg4NDItYjE3NTUxMzI2YmQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWMwMjVkYTQtYmVmYi00YjBjLTg4NDItYjE3NTUxMzI2YmQ5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this classic Academy Award winning drama"},"datePublished":"1964-12-14","description":"An uptight English writer travelling to Crete, on a matter of business, finds his life changed forever when he meets the gregarious Alexis Zorba.","keywords":"writer,greece,sirtaki,riding a donkey,song and dance","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0057831/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ma-cortes"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Memorable and attractive film with intense drama , top-drawer interpretation and unforgettable musical score","reviewBody":"Top-notch picture based on an adaptation of Nikos Kazantzakis's hugely popular novel . It deals with an uptight and poignant English writer called Basil (Alan Bates was Mihalis Kakogiannis's first choice for this part) traveling to Crete on a matter of business finds his life changed forever when he meets the zesty as well as joyful Zorba (in title role Anthony Quinn displays an awesome acting , he is a delight as Alexis) . Gregarious Zorba is an eye-opener to the visiting stranger . At a tiny village the writer meets an old spinster woman named Madame Hortense (Lila Kedrova was a win an Academy Award, though Simone Signoret was the original choice for this role and turned it down and she came to regret that decision) and a beautiful widow (a young Irene Papas) . 

Sensitive and thought-provoking film plenty of drama , emotion , Greek social habits and wonderful performances .Interesting and flavorful screenplay by the same filmmaker from Nikos Kazantzakis' novel who also wrote ¨The last temptation of Christ¨. Special mention to Anthony Quinn as an uncomplicated and jolly man , an earthy and humble peasant with a real lust for life , a character he has become identified with . However , in the earlier stages of filming, the filmmaker and Anthony Quinn had frequent disagreements as the director felt that his leading actor was being too over-the-top . Alan Bates as a sensible as well as intellectual writer is also very good and the young beauty Irene Papas is marvelous as a widow who originates a tragedy . Extraordinary Lila Kedrova as an aging and dying courtesan, she ended up receiving an Academy Award for her role. The original Broadway production of "Zorba" opened at the Imperial Theater in New York on November 16, 1968, ran for 305 performances and was nominated for the 1969 Tony Award for the Best Musical. Anthony Quinn and Lila Kedrova who starred together in this movie version appeared in the revival of Zorba in 1982-3 with Lila Kedrova winning the 1984 Tony Award for Best Featured Actress in a Musical . 

Gorgeous , enjoyable cinematography in white and black by Walter Lassally that also won deservedly an Oscar. Rousing and immortal soundtrack by Mikis Theodorakis based on Greek traditional music , including breathtaking dances performed by Anthony Quinn. However , Anthony Quinn had a broken foot during filming, and thus couldn't perform the dance on the beach as scripted, which called for much leaping around ; instead, he did a slow shuffle . This brooding motion picture was stunningly directed by Michael Cacoyannis ,though the project was turned down by every major studio . Cacoyannis was an expert on adaptations based upon Classic Greek plays such as ¨Iphigenea¨ , ¨Elektra¨ and ¨The Trojan women¨ . ¨Zorba¨ rating : Better than average , worthwhile watching . Essential and indispensable seeing for Anthony Quinn fans .","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21382,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"duration":"PT2H22M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Smokey and the Bandit II
Smoki i Bandit 2
programme.desc:
Smokey and the Bandit II: Directed by Hal Needham. With Burt Reynolds, Jackie Gleason, Jerry Reed, Dom DeLuise. The Bandit goes on another cross-country run, transporting an elephant from Florida to Texas. And, once again, Sheriff Buford T. Justice is on his tail." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0081529/","name":"Smokey and the Bandit II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmFhMGQ5NTEtMTE3Zi00YjBlLWI0OTItNDQwNGVkNWU5MmE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000608/","name":"Burt Reynolds"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001276/","name":"Jackie Gleason"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0715274/","name":"Jerry Reed"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0624102/","name":"Hal Needham"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047780/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0624102/","name":"Hal Needham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0506597/","name":"Robert L. Levy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069547/","name":"Jerry Belson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2523708185","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzhkOTg2ZjctZDYxMS00YjU5LWJhMDgtZDYyYjg3NzJkNjU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzhkOTg2ZjctZDYxMS00YjU5LWJhMDgtZDYyYjg3NzJkNjU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"datePublished":"1980-08-15","description":"The Bandit goes on another cross-country run, transporting an elephant from Florida to Texas. And, once again, Sheriff Buford T. Justice is on his tail.","keywords":"sheriff,road movie,elephant,car crash,trucker","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0081529/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"billybrown41"},"dateCreated":"2002-07-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"What went wrong here?","reviewBody":"I know I've mentioned before that I wasn't even going to bother writing a review for this one, but here it is: I've always wanted to like this movie. I really have. Being an enormous fan of the first, and even finding some enjoyment from the third, I still can't say I like this one. I don't know what happened here. Everyone was back, inculding the director, they had the money to back it up, and they still couldn't get it right. What made this film so atrocious? Well, I have to blame it on the writers. I also have to blame the rest of the cast for going along with it. Seriously, when the characters behave NOTHING like they did in the original and the objective is to haul an elephant(!), you know you're in trouble. I cringed every time Frog and the Bandit squabbled and I cringed whenever the Bandit would lose his cool and do something stupid. I mean, what happened to the mild-mannered, likeable, laid-back country boy that we all knew and loved from the first one? Why in the HELL did they have to make him into and alcoholic, washed-up, ego-maniac? I don't know how, but they managed to make him into one of the most unlikeable protagonists in cinematic history. There's even a ridiculous training scene where the Snowman and Frog whip the bandit back into shape to make the big run. I guess it was supposed to be funny. I found it to be a slap in the face. Sometimes Hollywood really has me scatching my head. 

Now, for the Justices. Two words: Good grief. They made them even dumber than in the first, and while there are a few funny lines, it goes into overdrive and messes the whole thing up. Another thing, Buford's Canadian cousin (I forget his name) was a disgrace. Was he supposed to be gay? If so, that wasn't funny either.

I guess I've trashed this one enough. On the bright side, there were a few moments that made me giggle, but I can't remember the scenes to save my life. Please, if you consider yourself a fan of the first, avoid this one. Save yourself a lot of disappointment."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15034,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Vila Marija
programme.desc: Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je... Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je pedesetogodišnjak, vodi porodični biznis koji uključuje lanac restorana i hotel u centru grada, koji je počeo da gradi još u vreme socijalizma, ali ga je u vlasništvo preuzeo tokom privatizacije devedesetih novcem svoje tete Mitzy. Njegova žena Ana Jurak (Ksenija Pajić), u ranim četrdesetim, rodila mu je dvoje dece- Ivana i Doru. Ana je napustila studije prava kad ga je upoznala i posvetila se brizi o porodici i uz pomoć kućne pomoćnice, brizi o samoj sebi-shopping, bazen i tračanje, omiljene su joj obaveze. Kako god bilo, ona je u svakom slučaju temelj familije. Ćerka Dora (Jelena Veljača) ima 20 godina i studira ekonomiju. Otac je obožava i ne prihvata činjenicu da je već odavno došla u godine da ima dečka i svoju intimu. Razmažena tatina kćer. Ivan (Mislav Čavajda) radi s ocem u firmi. Zgodan zagrebački dečko, dvadesetpetogodišnjak, ali neodgovoran, sklon porocima, ukratko, loš karakter lepog lica. S druge strane, nalazi se porodica bankara Maksa Lovreka (Ante Čedo Martinić), koji Jurakovoj firmi daje veliki kredit za preuzimanje malotrgovinskog lanca. On i Tomislav Jurak (ne)prijatelji su još od falultetskih dana. Uz posao, Jurakovi i Lovrekovi povezani su i privatno, a razdoblje prividnog prijateljstva s početka priče ubrzo prerasta u suparništvo. Max Lovrek oženjen je Vesnom Lovrek (Barbara Vicković), ženom sumnjivog karaktera, koja je pritom Maksu neverna. Bankar Lovrek iz prvog braka ima sina Svena (Sven Madžarević), 2o godišnjaka, prilično povučenog, skromnog dečka. Maks kuje zaveru protiv Juraka s Jurakovim ambicioznim sinom Ivanom. Treća glavna ekipa su bolesna majka Dunja (Nada Gačešić Livaković) i njen sin Luka (Damir Markovina), pametan i obrazovan mladić koji neumorno radi kod Jurakovih, ali ne razume da ga oni iskorištavaju. Ima i razloga za slepilo: voli Jurakovu ćerku, Doru. Njihovu vezu Tomislav Jurak nikad ne bi dopustio...

programme.title: Ljubav u zaleđu
programme.desc: U središtu priče su dve generacije triju porodica povezanih fudbalom. Serija prati živote četvorice mladića iz predgrađa koji su odrasli uz fudbal. U središtu priče su dve generacije triju porodica povezanih fudbalom. Serija prati živote četvorice mladića iz predgrađa koji su odrasli uz fudbal. Dvojica od njih napravili su profesionalne karijere kao fudbaleri, jedan je postao uspešan trener, a poslednji je u menadžerskim vodama. U mladosti, na vrhuncu karijere, jedan od mladića tragično je izgubio život, nakon čega su ostale životni putevi odveli na različite strane.Serija počinje dvadeset pet godina kasnije kad su svi ponovo u Zagrebu. Osim što ih veže fudbal i zajednička prošlost, likovi serije su i u složenim emotivnim odnosima. Paralelno se prate i životi njihove dece, koji su odrastali pod uticajem fudbala, te su često opterećeni prošlošću svojih roditelja. U središtu je ljubav dvoje mladih, fudbalera Marka Marušića i slikarke Nine Radić. Njihova ljubavna priča je puna prepreka i zapleta zbog različitih sredina i naizgled nespojivih životnih stilova.

credits.actor: Jelisaveta Sablić, Nikola Simić, Mirka Vasiljević, Zijah Sokolović, Marija Karan

programme.title: Kafanica blizu SiS-a
programme.desc: Već znamo da je "Agencija za sve i svašta" vlasotinačko preduzeće koje rešava sve probleme svojih klijenata. Osnivač i vlasnik firme je Spiridon Don Karamarković, nekadašnji pripadnik Legije stranaca,... Već znamo da je "Agencija za sve i svašta" vlasotinačko preduzeće koje rešava sve probleme svojih klijenata. Osnivač i vlasnik firme je Spiridon Don Karamarković, nekadašnji pripadnik Legije stranaca, ekspert za sva pitanja i najškrtiji gazda na svetu. Deda mu je rekao da svaki uspešan Srbin mora da ima kafanu i on je ove godine osnovao svoju. Poslove oko kafane poverio je misterioznoj Madam Žaklini koja je naše gore list, ali je ugostiteljsko znanje sticala u Parizu.

programme.title: M(j)ešoviti brak
programme.desc: Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Naravno, dodati su novi likovi, proširena je priča, a gastarbajterska porodica Čađenovic vratila se u novu državu, Srbiju i Crnu Goru. Čuli su za promene, pa su odlučili da posle više godina boravka u Lucernu, u Švajcarskoj, teško zarađene devize ulože u bisnis u Beogradu. Sasvim slucajno, prvi kadrovi ove serije snimljeni su u državi koja se zvala Jugoslavija, a prva epizoda završena je u državi, koja se poput ovog mešovitog braka Crnogorca i Srpkinje, zove Srbija i Crna Gora.

credits.actor: Jasmina Avramović, Marko Nikolić ml., Nataša Ninković, Jelica Sretenović, Boris Komnenić, Vojislav Brajović, Marko Nikolic, Jasmina Avramovic

programme.title: Ljubav u zaledju
Ljubav u zaleđu
programme.desc: Ljubav u zaledju: Created by Diana Peckaj Vukovic. With Maja Noveljic-Romcevic, Filip Juricic, Iva Viskovic, Ksenija Pajic. Family saga about three families, all living in city of Zagreb, and all connected with love towards European football.(40 min)" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0482074/","name":"Ljubav u zaledju","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGExNjhhOGEtYjA5Ny00NzQxLWE3NTQtMDM3MDg5OTk4ODU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzIwMTIwODc@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama","Romance","Sport"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1059092/","name":"Maja Noveljic-Romcevic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1251869/","name":"Filip Juricic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2060274/","name":"Iva Viskovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0158919/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2059678/","name":"Diana Peckaj Vukovic"}],"datePublished":"2005-10-03","description":"Family saga about three families, all living in city of Zagreb, and all connected with love towards European football.(40 min)","keywords":"love","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0482074/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"en_extasis"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"LJUBAV U ZALEDJU (Love in the Offside)","reviewBody":"LOVE IN THE OFFSIDE is the exciting Croatian Telenovela. It is a family story placed in the recognizable urban area of Zagreb. The story centers around two generations of three families connected by football. The show follows the lives of four young men from the suburbs, which grew up playing football. Two of them became professional football players, one became a successful coach and one became a manager. At the peak of his career, one of the youths was tragically killed, while the other three went their separate ways. The drama begins 25 years later, when they all returned to Zagreb. In addition to having football and their past in common, the characters find themselves in complex emotional relations. At the same time, the show follows the lives of their children, which were unavoidably affected by football and burdened with their parents' past. The center of the story is the love of two young people, a football player Marko Marusic and painter Nina Radic. Due to different surroundings and what seem to be incompatible life styles, their love story is very turbulent.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":262,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.8}}</script><metacontent="

credits.actor: Jelisaveta Sablić, Nikola Simić, Mirka Vasiljević, Zijah Sokolović, Marija Karan

programme.title: Kafanica blizu SiS-a
programme.desc: Već znamo da je "Agencija za sve i svašta" vlasotinačko preduzeće koje rešava sve probleme svojih klijenata. Već znamo da je "Agencija za sve i svašta" vlasotinačko preduzeće koje rešava sve probleme svojih klijenata. Osnivač i vlasnik firme je Spiridon Don Karamarković, nekadašnji pripadnik Legije stranaca, ekspert za sva pitanja i najškrtiji gazda na svetu. Deda mu je rekao da svaki uspešan Srbin mora da ima kafanu i on je ove godine osnovao svoju. Poslove oko kafane poverio je misterioznoj Madam Žaklini koja je naše gore list, ali je ugostiteljsko znanje sticala u Parizu.

programme.title: M(j)ešoviti brak
programme.desc: Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Naravno, dodati su novi likovi, proširena je priča, a gastarbajterska porodica Čađenovic vratila se u novu državu, Srbiju i Crnu Goru. Čuli su za promene, pa su odlučili da posle više godina boravka u Lucernu, u Švajcarskoj, teško zarađene devize ulože u bisnis u Beogradu. Sasvim slucajno, prvi kadrovi ove serije snimljeni su u državi koja se zvala Jugoslavija, a prva epizoda završena je u državi, koja se poput ovog mešovitog braka Crnogorca i Srpkinje, zove Srbija i Crna Gora.

programme.title: Idealne veze
programme.desc: Prvi put u našim serijama zavirićemo iza kulisa jednog umjetničkog braka. On je velika glumačka zvijezda, slavljen i tražen na sve strane, željan da bar u sopstvenoj kući nađe neophodan mir. Ona je... Prvi put u našim serijama zavirićemo iza kulisa jednog umjetničkog braka. On je velika glumačka zvijezda, slavljen i tražen na sve strane, željan da bar u sopstvenoj kući nađe neophodan mir. Ona je mlada i atraktivna glumica, željna uzbuđenja, uvijek spremna na akciju.

programme.title: Hotel sa 7 zvezdica
programme.desc: Naziv serije je asocijacija na sedam glavnih likova, sedam radnika starog beogradskog hotela koji je stecište sumnjivih tipova i paravan za razne mutne poslove. Naziv serije je asocijacija na sedam glavnih likova, sedam radnika starog beogradskog hotela koji je stecište sumnjivih tipova i paravan za razne mutne poslove. Zaposleni pokušavaju da odole radoznalosti finansijske policije, a upravnik se trudi da sačuva fotelju. Uz razne zgode i nezgode, kroz hotel defiluje čitava galerija prevaranata, lažnih milionera i lovaca u mutnom.

programme.title: Vila Marija
programme.desc: Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je... Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je pedesetogodišnjak, vodi porodični biznis koji uključuje lanac restorana i hotel u centru grada, koji je počeo da gradi još u vreme socijalizma, ali ga je u vlasništvo preuzeo tokom privatizacije devedesetih novcem svoje tete Mitzy. Njegova žena Ana Jurak (Ksenija Pajić), u ranim četrdesetim, rodila mu je dvoje dece- Ivana i Doru. Ana je napustila studije prava kad ga je upoznala i posvetila se brizi o porodici i uz pomoć kućne pomoćnice, brizi o samoj sebi-shopping, bazen i tračanje, omiljene su joj obaveze. Kako god bilo, ona je u svakom slučaju temelj familije. Ćerka Dora (Jelena Veljača) ima 20 godina i studira ekonomiju. Otac je obožava i ne prihvata činjenicu da je već odavno došla u godine da ima dečka i svoju intimu. Razmažena tatina kćer. Ivan (Mislav Čavajda) radi s ocem u firmi. Zgodan zagrebački dečko, dvadesetpetogodišnjak, ali neodgovoran, sklon porocima, ukratko, loš karakter lepog lica. S druge strane, nalazi se porodica bankara Maksa Lovreka (Ante Čedo Martinić), koji Jurakovoj firmi daje veliki kredit za preuzimanje malotrgovinskog lanca. On i Tomislav Jurak (ne)prijatelji su još od falultetskih dana. Uz posao, Jurakovi i Lovrekovi povezani su i privatno, a razdoblje prividnog prijateljstva s početka priče ubrzo prerasta u suparništvo. Max Lovrek oženjen je Vesnom Lovrek (Barbara Vicković), ženom sumnjivog karaktera, koja je pritom Maksu neverna. Bankar Lovrek iz prvog braka ima sina Svena (Sven Madžarević), 2o godišnjaka, prilično povučenog, skromnog dečka. Maks kuje zaveru protiv Juraka s Jurakovim ambicioznim sinom Ivanom. Treća glavna ekipa su bolesna majka Dunja (Nada Gačešić Livaković) i njen sin Luka (Damir Markovina), pametan i obrazovan mladić koji neumorno radi kod Jurakovih, ali ne razume da ga oni iskorištavaju. Ima i razloga za slepilo: voli Jurakovu ćerku, Doru. Njihovu vezu Tomislav Jurak nikad ne bi dopustio...

programme.title: Ljubav u zaleđu
programme.desc: U središtu priče su dve generacije triju porodica povezanih fudbalom. Serija prati živote četvorice mladića iz predgrađa koji su odrasli uz fudbal. U središtu priče su dve generacije triju porodica povezanih fudbalom. Serija prati živote četvorice mladića iz predgrađa koji su odrasli uz fudbal. Dvojica od njih napravili su profesionalne karijere kao fudbaleri, jedan je postao uspešan trener, a poslednji je u menadžerskim vodama. U mladosti, na vrhuncu karijere, jedan od mladića tragično je izgubio život, nakon čega su ostale životni putevi odveli na različite strane.Serija počinje dvadeset pet godina kasnije kad su svi ponovo u Zagrebu. Osim što ih veže fudbal i zajednička prošlost, likovi serije su i u složenim emotivnim odnosima. Paralelno se prate i životi njihove dece, koji su odrastali pod uticajem fudbala, te su često opterećeni prošlošću svojih roditelja. U središtu je ljubav dvoje mladih, fudbalera Marka Marušića i slikarke Nine Radić. Njihova ljubavna priča je puna prepreka i zapleta zbog različitih sredina i naizgled nespojivih životnih stilova.

credits.actor: Jelisaveta Sablić, Nikola Simić, Mirka Vasiljević, Zijah Sokolović, Marija Karan
